Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates and manages the map within the non-GUI game.
    Author:
    Jarett Allie

      boolean checkFloorComplete()
      This checks if the floor is completed.
      private void fillBoard()
      This fills the board to instantiate it.
      protected java.lang.String getPlayerPos()
      This returns the player's position as a string in (x,y) order.
      private boolean isMoveValid()
      This is an array out of bounds check to make sure the player doesn't move out of bounds.
      protected void move(char choice)
      This moves the player based on the command passed from GameNoGUI.

      This prints the game board and map key.

      This starts the game and instantiates the board.
      private void treasureRoom()
      This is ran when treasure is found.
      private void updateCharPos()
      This updates the characters position after a move.

      • Map

        public Map()

    • Method Detail

      • checkFloorComplete

        public boolean checkFloorComplete()
        This checks if the floor is completed.
        Returns:
        exitCheck boolean.

      • fillBoard

        private void fillBoard()
        This fills the board to instantiate it.

      • getPlayerPos

        protected java.lang.String getPlayerPos()
        This returns the player's position as a string in (x,y) order.
        Returns:
        String with the position of player.

      • isMoveValid

        private boolean isMoveValid()
        This is an array out of bounds check to make sure the player doesn't move out of bounds.
        Returns:
        if a move is valid, true.

      • move

        protected void move(char choice)
        This moves the player based on the command passed from GameNoGUI.
        Parameters:
        choice - the direction to move.

      • printBoard

        protected void printBoard()
        This prints the game board and map key.

      • setExit

        private void setExit()
        This sets where the exit will be on the map. Reaching this room will "reset" the map to be a new floor.

      • setPlayer

        private void setPlayer()
        This sets the player's position.

      • setTreasure

        private void setTreasure()
        This sets where treasure will be set on the floor.

      • startGame

        protected void startGame()
        This starts the game and instantiates the board. This also sets treasure, the player, and the exit.

      • treasureRoom

        private void treasureRoom()
        This is ran when treasure is found.

      • updateCharPos

        private void updateCharPos()
        This updates the characters position after a move. This also will check if a player reaches a treasure room, enemy room, or exit room.
